title: Who still uses CD players? - Quora

response.answer_text: Apparently a lot of music fans. I count at least 30 companies in 2019 selling CD players from about $200 USD to over $10,000 and several of those offer more than one model. I don’t think there are nearly as many different makers of DVD players these days. People still enjoy collecting a physical CD, plus they know the recording will be on their shelf without worrying that a streaming company may lose the rights to some artists.

One could, but there are smarter options nowadays. Any laptop can play a CD. The problem is that the sound output from the laptop’s own digital to audio converter (DAC) is usually miserable. The solution is to use a DAC attached to the USB port of the laptop. The Audioquest Dragonfly is one such extremely portable equipment which though not cheap is a more affordable option to buying a high end CD player. Other important additional investment should go into quality - laptop to pre-amplifier to amplifier to speaker connections and room acoustics.
